intro: Teline pallida, commonly known as the pale teline, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of the Middle East. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in open woodland or grassland habitats. Its leaves are finely divided and aromatic, and it blooms from late spring to early summer. Teline pallida is a hardy perennial that is relatively low maintenance and suitable for rock gardens or borders.
